ninja.ugly.prevail.chunk
Class VolatileChunk<K,V>

java.lang.Object
  ninja.ugly.prevail.chunk.DefaultChunk<K,V>
      ninja.ugly.prevail.chunk.VolatileChunk<K,V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Chunk<K,V>
public class VolatileChunk<K,V>
extends DefaultChunk<K,V>

A simple extension of DefaultChunk that stores data in memory.

Nested Class Summary

          A factory class for producing keys from values.

Constructor Detail

VolatileChunk

public VolatileChunk(VolatileChunk.KeyFactory<K,V> keyFactory)
Constructs a new HashMapChunk that uses the given KeyFactory to generate keys during insertion.

Parameters:
keyFactory - A KeyFactory used to create keys to insert objects under.

VolatileChunk

public VolatileChunk(java.util.Map<K,V> map,
                     VolatileChunk.KeyFactory<K,V> keyFactory)
Constructs a new HashMapChunk that uses the given backing Map and the given KeyFactory to generate keys during insertion.

This implementation uses the given Map directly for storage. Changes to this Chunk will be reflected in the given Map, and vice-versa.

Parameters:
map - The Map to use as backing storage.
keyFactory - A KeyFactory used to create keys to insert objects under.

doUpdate

protected int doUpdate(K key,
                       V value,
                       DefaultChunk.OnProgressUpdateListener progressUpdateListener)
                throws UpdateException
Update the given key in backing storage with the given value.

Some Chunk implementations might allow update of multiple values with a non-specific key. Not this one.

Specified by:
doUpdate in class DefaultChunk<K,V>
Parameters:
key - The key of the value to be updated.
value - The value to be stored.
Returns:
The number of elements updated. Either 0 or 1.

UpdateException
